qas.question: In the aftermath of which war was the U.S. granted Puerto Rico?
What country handed over Puerto Rico to the US?
How long have Puerto Ricans been U.S. citizens?
What form of government do the Puerto Ricans have?
In the aftermath of which war was the U.S. granted Congress?
What country handed over Congress to the US?
How long has Congress been U.S. citizens?
What form of government does Spain have?
How long has Spain been under U.S. sovereignty?

context: Puerto Rico has been under U.S. sovereignty for <b8_0>over a century<b8_0/> when it was ceded to the U.S. by <a1_0><b5_0>Spain<b5_0/><a1_0/> following the end of the <a0_0><b4_0>Spanish–American War<b4_0/><a0_0/>, and Puerto Ricans have been U.S. citizens <a2_0><b6_0>since 1917<b6_0/><a2_0/>. The island's ultimate status has not been determined as of 2012[update], its residents do not have voting representation in their federal government. Puerto Rico has limited representation in the U.S. Congress in the form of a Resident Commissioner, a delegate with limited no voting rights. Like the states, Puerto Rico has self-rule, a <a3_0><b7_0>republican<b7_0/><a3_0/> form of government organized pursuant to a constitution adopted by its people, and a bill of rights.
